title: News Corp's Retailer-Marketing Business Faces Monopoly Allegations
summary: Insignia Systems lawsuit claims News America Marketing unit used exclusionary contracts with clients. A News Corp competitor claims the company and two subsidiaries that are part of its in-store advertising business, News America Marketing, have created a monopoly in violation of a federal antitrust law.

title: Trump, Twitter and the First Amendment
summary: An appellate ruling blurs the line between private and public forums.. Donald Trump has disrupted American politics as social media has public discourse. Both are now causing judges to lose sight of important First Amendment principles, as the Second Circuit Court of Appeals demonstrated this week in a troubling decision that deems President Trump's Twitter account a public forum.

title: Pelosi's House Discipline
summary: She gets hit with the race card for standing up to the young radicals.. Having spent so long defaming conservatives as racists, progressives can't stop turning the accusation on each other. Two weeks ago Democratic presidential contenders all but called Joe Biden a segregationist. This week Nancy Pelosi got a taste of her party's poison.

title: Requiem for a Rebate Rule
summary: The feds discover that meddling in drug prices creates more problems.. The Trump Administration on Thursday abandoned one of its drug pricing rules, and the details are arcane but the lesson is simple: Regulating health-care markets is too often a game of whack-a-mole. The Administration tried to solve one problem and ended up creating others, which is a predictable result of political intervention.

title: Amazon to Retrain a Third of Its U.S. Workforce
summary: As technology reshapes roles, the online retailer plans to train 100,000 workers in new skills, from machine learning to nursing. U.S. companies are increasingly paying up to retrain workers as new technologies transform the workplace and companies struggle to recruit talent in one of the hottest job markets in decades.

title: The Fed Could Use a Golden Rule
summary: Abandon the Ph.D. standard, which brought the era of government bailouts and too big to fail.. Though money can't talk, people can't stop talking about it. With the nomination of Judy Shelton to the Federal Reserve Board, the discussion has tilted to gold.

title: A Connecticut Girl Challenges Male Domination of Female Sports
summary: Selina Soule, 16, says letting boys compete as girls violates Title IX's ban on discrimination.. Glastonbury, Conn.

title: 'Homeplace' Review: Enticed by Twang and Sawdust
summary: The last roadhouse in the Virginias, where Budweisers, Beatitudes and country music mingle-and a fading subculture finds a home.. Among the collateral calamities of our era's descent into health obsession is the decline of the traditional honky-tonk. The heart skips a beat in fond remembrance of these roadside establishments, which dispensed-enthusiastically and in good conscience-pork rinds and pickled pig's feet. (Knuckle sandwiches were also available, gratis.) They were smokier than Krakatoa and sold libations that, if ingested accidentally by a contemporary booze snob, might cause him to jump off a bridge to escape everlasting shame.

title: It's Game Over for the Gandhis as a Political Dynasty Dies
summary: India's Congress Party has become a rudderless mess. Its leader's resignation is a chance to begin anew.. Can India's Congress Party survive without the Nehru-Gandhi dynasty with which it has become synonymous? For dynasty loyalists, habituated to treating India's oldest political party as a family fiefdom, the thought is heretical. But they need to acknowledge a harsh truth: 49-year-old Rahul Gandhi has become a liability for the party his family has helmed for much of the past 70 years.

title: Reparations and the Spirit of 1789
summary: Burke's concerns about the French Revolution resonate in today's debate.. The long train of abuses and usurpations known as the French Revolution began in earnest 230 years ago Sunday with the storming of the Bastille prison in Paris.

title: Stronger Inflation Data Lift Treasury Yields
summary: Demand at the auction of 30-year Treasury bonds was soft. U.S. government bonds pulled back sharply Thursday, pushing yields to their highest levels in four weeks, after new data showed consumer prices rose more than expected in June.

title: Pelosi's Prima Donnas
summary: Her feud with 'The Squad' may imperil Democratic chances in November 2020.. Speaker Nancy Pelosi this week stepped up to stare down a rebellion, and the Democrats' 2020 chances may hinge on whether she proves successful. Watch to see if the steely-eyed Californian can convince her party's pragmatists to hold out against its prima donnas.

title: Is God the Answer to the Suicide Epidemic?
summary: Someone who attends religious services is significantly less likely to kill himself.. The rate at which Americans take their own lives has been climbing for 20 years, prompting policy makers and medical experts to search for novel suicide-prevention practices. But one approach is as old as civilization itself: religious faith. Encouraging the most vulnerable Americans to attend religious services could reduce the suicide rate, and a new type of church growing in the U.S. shows particular promise.

title: Longtime Journal Reporter Lucette Lagnado Dies at 62
summary: Prizewinning writer tapped into her own experiences to tell memorable stories about the health-care industry, immigration and Jewish culture. Lucette Lagnado, a prizewinning author and reporter for The Wall Street Journal, brought a writer's curiosity and a patient's empathy to storytelling, illuminating the plight of the uninsured, the sick and the elderly for readers around the world.

title: I Come to Bury Biden, Not to Praise Him
summary: Ocasio-Cortez emerges as a one-woman Committee to Re-Elect the President.. Three small points we labor mightily to connect:

title: Illumina Stock Falls as Revenue Outlook Reduced
summary: Maker of gene-sequencing machines cites problems with direct-to-consumer business. Illumina Inc., the maker of gene-sequencing machines, lowered its second-quarter revenue expectations over problems with its direct-to-consumer business and reduced sales of its sequencing systems.

title: Protesters Disrupt Amazon Event Over Its Ties With ICE
summary: New York summit draws demonstrators who call on company to cut links to immigration enforcement. NEW YORK-Protesters disrupted an Amazon.com Inc. event Thursday, voicing opposition to the company's ties to entities that enforce the Trump administration's crackdown on illegal immigration.

title: Racial Issues Surface in Dispute Between Pelosi, House Freshmen
summary: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez accused the speaker of singling out women of color in remarks that drew rebukes from some fellow Democrats. WASHINGTON-Race has become a flashpoint in the growing dispute between House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and a quartet of liberal freshmen lawmakers, again pitting Democratic members against each other in starkly personal terms.

title: Biden Has Poll Lead After First Democratic Debates
summary: Wall Street Journal/NBC News poll has the former vice president at the front of the pack among Democratic voters, with Sen. Elizabeth Warren not far behind. The crowded Democratic presidential field has sorted into a top tier of five candidates after the first debates, with former Vice President Joe Biden in the lead and Sen. Elizabeth Warren narrowly behind him, a new Wall Street Journal/NBC News poll finds.

title: New Yorkers Line Up for Italy's Most Savored Specialties
summary: Monthlong pop-up involving a sandwich maker from Florence, Italy, draws to a close on Saturday. New Yorkers have never had to travel far or wait for a long time to get a good Italian sandwich, stuffed with meat and cheese. But for the past month, thousands have come to a Greenwich Village restaurant and stood in line for up to 2½ hours for a particular version.

title: Head of Boeing's 737 MAX Program Retires
summary: Eric Lindblad, 34-year veteran of the plane maker, ran embattled unit for less than a year. Boeing Co. said the head of its 737 MAX production facility will retire after less than a year at a division engulfed in crisis following two fatal crashes of the aircraft.

title: Calpers Fell Short of Its Own Goals in Fiscal 2019
summary: Nation's largest pension fund earned 6.7% vs. target of 7%. The nation's largest pension fund fell just short of its investment target in fiscal 2019, underlining the difficulty of earning the kind of returns state and local funds need to pay future benefits.

title: The Price of Recycled Paper Is Weighing Down This REIT
summary: Data storer and paper shredder Iron Mountain was the S&P's biggest loser Thursday. The S&P 500 fell just short of its first ever 3000-point close Thursday. Part of the reason? Recycled paper.

title: Get Incentives Right to Build More Housing
summary: Prof. Anup Malani is biased toward government action and, no surprise, in favor of another new tax to remedy the shortage of what today is commonly called affordable housing.. Regarding Anup Malani's "To Encourage New Housing, Tax It" (op-ed, July 8): It seems the professor is biased toward government action and, no surprise, in favor of another new tax to remedy the shortage of what today is commonly called affordable housing. Citing Milton Friedman to bring free-market bona fides to his theory falls empty when Prof. Malani states in one sentence, "my proposal would improve the distribution of wealth" and, in another, "gains can be distributed to potential losers."

title: Polluting the Father of Waters and the Gulf
summary: If the Gulf of Mexico dead zone along the Louisiana and eastern Texas coast were an oil spill, the outrage led by the media and Beltway crowd would be 24/7.. "The World's Appetite Is Threatening the Mississippi" (U.S. News, July 3) describes the major ecological problem of the Gulf of Mexico dead zone because of the growth of algae in the summertime. A more serious problem developed more than a century ago, and continues to this day, when levees were built to contain the Mississippi River and natural outlets were closed. This was done to reduce the risk of flooding and to maintain deep channels for navigation. Unfortunately this has resulted in directing the river and its contents away from the deltas and marshes that need the fresh water and its sediment and contents to nourish and maintain them.

title: It's Not So Golden a State
summary: California claims a $21 billion surplus for this year's budget? I guess if you ignore its approximate $1 trillion-plus unfunded pension liability, that is true.. Regarding Allysia Finley's "The Troubles Beneath the Surface of California's Comeback" (Cross Country, June 29): California claims a $21 billion surplus for this year's budget? I guess if you ignore its approximate $1 trillion-plus unfunded pension liability (the Sacramento Bee's number), that is true. Only in government financial accounting can you ignore $1 trillion and do it with a straight face.

title: Justice Department Extends Compliance Breaks to Antitrust Offenders
summary: New policy makes deferred prosecution agreements available to companies that can show they had strong compliance programs when violation occurred. The U.S. Justice Department will begin rewarding companies that have systems in place to prevent antitrust crimes at the time a breach occurs, according to a senior official.

title: Following Epstein's Arrest, Spotlight Shifts to His Longtime Associate
summary: Ghislaine Maxwell, a British socialite, has been accused of recruiting young women for Epstein and training them for sex. Ghislaine Maxwell, daughter of a British media baron, was a fixture for years in Manhattan's social scene, often written about in tabloids for her close ties to British royalty and to a mysterious financier named Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Guatemala to Discuss Absorbing Central American Asylum Seekers
summary: Trump officials, Guatemalan president to consider deal to stem influx to U.S., over critics' concerns about migrants' safety. Guatemalan President Jimmy Morales plans to travel to Washington, D.C., on Monday to discuss a deal that would require migrants from neighboring El Salvador and Honduras to seek asylum in Guatemala rather than the U.S., as the Trump administration seeks to slow migrant flows.

title: Norwegian Air Replaces CEO, Forecasts Lower Growth
summary: Airline bet its cheap fares would distinguish it from U.S. rivals, but it has been hit by rising costs and stiff competition. Norwegian Air Shuttle AS A said founder Bjorn Kjos was stepping down as chief executive, as the airline reported sharply lower earnings, reduced its growth guidance and took a large accounting charge.

title: Fed's Brainard Sees Case for Easing Monetary Policy
summary: Business sentiment and investment will remain sensitive to trade and global outlook, Federal Reserve governor says. Federal Reserve governor Lael Brainard said Thursday that easier monetary policy was justified in light of growing risks to the economic outlook and weak inflation. She also said high levels of risky corporate debt should prompt the Fed to take more action to regulate financial institutions.

title: 'The Bournonville Legacy' Review: Excerpts From a Ballet Master
summary: At the Joyce Theater, members of the Royal Danish Ballet perform selections from the elaborate dances 19th-century choreographer August Bournonville created during his decades with the company..

title: 'The Farewell' Review: Tiptoeing Through a Family Charade
summary: Awkwafina stars-and shines-as a young Chinese-American woman who visits her dying grandmother in China.. The lovely paradox of "The Farewell" is that everyone in it tries to hide their feelings as long as they can, yet their story goes straight to your heart.

title: 'The Art of Self-Defense' Review: Violence Among Men
summary: Jesse Eisenberg stars as a meek loner seduced by a martial-arts cult in director Riley Stearns's new film.. From the first moment we see Casey, the shut-down loner played by Jesse Eisenberg in "The Art of Self-Defense," it's clear that he is on a spectrum, though exactly what spectrum remains to be revealed. The movie is concerned with the roots, as well as the seductive rewards, of violence. The news that it brings is less than startling-testosterone turns out to be the prime culprit-but this bleak, absurdist comedy by Riley Stearns has its own distinctive coloration. The tone is a delicate blend of solemn, droll and ominous, and Casey is an intriguing hero, a quintessential dweeb with an untapped wellspring of rage.

title: Taxi Cab Crashes into Manhattan Eatery
summary: Eight people suffer minor injuries after rear-ended cab jumps curb and slams into Hell's Kitchen restaurant. A yellow cab crashed into a Manhattan restaurant on Thursday afternoon, injuring eight people, according to the New York Police Department.

title: Biden Says U.S. Must Restore Alliances
summary: Trump's 'America First' policies have isolated U.S., 2020 Democratic candidate asserts. NEW YORK-Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden said the U.S. must move swiftly to restore international alliances and strengthen democracies around the globe, vowing to produce a broad reversal of President Trump's foreign policy if elected president.

title: Activists Try to Stop a Huge Chicago Development Over $1.3 Billion in Tax Incentives
summary: Site of former steel mill wedged between wealthy neighborhoods isn't 'blighted,' they say.

title: Delta Gains From MAX Grounding and High Demand
summary: Carrier raises profit outlook for 2019 amid robust summer bookings. Delta Air Lines Inc. DAL -3.99% raised its profit outlook for this year, as strong travel demand and the diminished capacity of competitors with grounded Boeing Co. 737 MAX jets buoyed the third-biggest U.S. carrier.

title: Best-Selling Books Week Ended July 6
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: Colgate to Acquire Skin-Care Business of Laboratoires Filorga Cosmetiques
summary: Colgate-Palmolive will pay $1.69 billion for Filorga. Colgate-Palmolive Co. said Thursday it would acquire the skin-care business of France's Laboratoires Filorga Cosmétiques for €1.5 billion ($1.69 billion).

title: 'Twelfth Night' Review: A Bland Transposition
summary: Shakespeare & Company sets the gleefully inventive comedy at a dance hall by the sea in 1959, but the move produces few delights and scant illumination.. Lenox, Mass.

title: 'Cymbeline' Review: A Lucid Take on Tragic Farce
summary: At the Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival, Davis McCallum directs one of the Bard's less popular plays in a production that flits gracefully between comedy and touching drama.. Garrison, N.Y.

title: 'Behind Closed Doors' Review: Trials Without End
summary: This two-part documentary about an unsolved case in India shows how the media influenced the notably inept investigation.. It doesn't take long for an atmosphere of derangement to settle in as the two-part documentary "Behind Closed Doors" (Tuesday and Wednesday, 8 p.m., HBO), about a murder case in India, unfolds. It was one that would hold much of the country in thrall for most of the next 10 years, for reasons this film makes perfectly clear in its appalling, incoherent, if also compelling way. In May 2008, 13-year-old Aarushi Talwar, the cherished only child of upper-middle-class parents, was found murdered in the bedroom of her family home in Noida. In the bordering-on-the-fantastical pursuit of justice that followed, which included three major investigations-as one folded for lack of success, another took over-the suspects kept changing, as did theories about who was guilty and who was not.

title: 'Sweetbitter' Review: A Welcome Second Serving
summary: The new season of the Starz drama returns to the high-pressure world of an elite restaurant.. 'Sweetbitter" returns for a second season Sunday on Starz, powered, like its first, with unfailing wit, superbly conceived characters, and confidence in its own strength. That last thoroughly justified essential comes shining through every scene of this series about life in a high-end Manhattan restaurant, largely as seen through the eyes of Tess (Ella Purnell), who has, in her early 20s, left Middle America behind for the wonders of New York. And for this job, which she, like most of her restaurant colleagues, however cynical and profane, views as a sacred calling.

title: Investors Finding Dividends in an Unlikely Place: Energy
summary: Energy ETF's dividend yield is beating utilities for just the second time in a decade. With interest rates poised to fall, investors are hunting for a way to squeeze a little more profit from their portfolios.

title: Fed's Williams Joins With Other Officials Leaning Toward Rate Cuts
summary: New York Fed leader says that 'arguments for adding policy accommodation have strengthened over time'. ALBANY, N.Y.-Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said the case for lowering short-term interest rates is getting stronger, opening the door to his support for easier monetary policy at the end of this month.

title: Trump Administration Drops Plan to Curb Drug Rebates
summary: The proposal had aimed to drive down the prices consumers pay for prescriptions. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration dropped a major piece of its plan to curb drug prices, the latest sign that central planks of President Trump's proposal are faltering amid legal challenges, high costs for taxpayers and feuds between the White House and government agencies.

title: U.S. Reaches $1.4 Billion Opioid-Drug Settlement With U.K.'s Reckitt
summary: Sales and marketing of a former Reckitt subsidiary's opioid-addiction treatment had been subject to U.S. investigations. LONDON- Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC agreed to pay up to $1.4 billion to settle U.S. investigations into whether its former pharmaceuticals unit organized a multibillion-dollar fraud to drive up sales of an opioid-addiction treatment.

title: Health-Care Rally Helps Lift Dow Over 27000
summary: Blue-chip index finishes above 27000, while S&P 500 battles back to finish day higher. A rally in health-care stocks pushed the Dow Jones Industrial Average over 27000 for the first time after the Trump administration abandoned a plan to curb drug rebates.

title: Insurer Relief Could Come at Pharma's Expense
summary: Health insurers surged after the Trump Administration scrapped its proposed drug-rebate rule, but not everyone is celebrating. Just two days after the future of the Affordable Care Act was once again called into question, health insurers scored a big win. Investors should expect the risk of adverse regulation to shift, rather than vanish altogether.

title: House Judiciary Committee Authorizes Subpoenas to Trump Officials, Others
summary: Panel says it could target officials including Jared Kushner, John Kelly as well as National Enquirer publisher David Pecker. WASHINGTON-The House Judiciary Committee voted to authorize subpoenas to a dozen people in President Trump's orbit, including his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, as part of Democrats' widening probe into possible obstruction of justice and abuse of power in the White House.

title: Google Contractors Listen to Virtual-Assistant Conversations
summary: Alphabet unit says 0.2% of 'audio snippets' are checked to better understand language differences. Google said contractors are listening to customer audio recorded by the company's virtual assistant, a disclosure prompted by a media report that adds to privacy concerns associated with the technology.

title: Oil's Rebound Above $60 Increases Focus on Technicals
summary: West Texas Intermediate futures closed above $60 for the first time in seven weeks Wednesday and edged down 0.4% Thursday. A recent rebound in U.S. crude-oil prices back above the closely watched psychological level of $60 is increasing focus on gauges of market momentum, the latest swing in a topsy-turvy 2019 for energy markets.

title: Philadelphia Safe-Injection Site Draws Supporters in Court
summary: Federal suit seeks to block opening, saying it violates law. Authorities from seven states, the District of Columbia and some major U.S. cities are backing a Philadelphia effort to open a supervised drug-injection site, which the federal government is trying to stop in court.

title: Paul Singer's Elliott Scores Big Win in PG&E Clash
summary: California legislators side with PG&E bondholders in tussle with shareholders over wildfire-liability bill. The California legislature delivered a preliminary victory to hedge-fund billionaire Paul Singer and other PG&E Corp. bondholders in their monthslong battle with the utility's shareholders.

title: Cargill Profit Drops on Trade, Flooding Challenges
summary: Grain giant's earnings hurt by transportation disruptions and U.S.-China dispute. Cargill Inc. is altering its global food trading to navigate production problems and trade disputes that have cut deeply into the agricultural giant's profit.

title: Computers Can Now Bluff Like a Poker Champ. Better, Actually.
summary: A new artificial intelligence program is so advanced at a key human skill-deception- that it wiped out five human poker players with one lousy hand. A super-powered computer performed trillions of calculations to hone an elusive skill: bluffing. Then it proceeded to wipe out five human poker champions with one lousy hand.

title: Apple Pulls Watch App After Finding Eavesdropping Glitch
summary: Watch app disabled as tech giant addresses security flaw potentially letting users listen in on iPhone calls. Apple Inc. has disabled the Walkie-Talkie app on Apple Watches after finding a security flaw that could allow a person to listen in on someone else's iPhone conversation without consent, the second eavesdropping-related glitch the company has moved to address in recent months as scrutiny of tech giants intensifies.

title: New Alnylam Pharmaceuticals CFO Faces Competition Challenge With Pfizer
summary: The biopharmaceuticals company on Thursday named a former Shire-executive to become its next finance chief. Alnylam Pharmaceuticals Inc. named a new finance chief, a move that comes as the biopharmaceutical company faces new competition from drug giant Pfizer Inc.

title: Saudis Plan to Ease Travel Restrictions on Women
summary: Allowing women to move freely across borders would be a departure from the kingdom's male-dominated guardianship system. Saudi Arabia is planning this year to loosen restrictions on women's ability to travel without a male guardian's permission, officials and people familiar with the matter said, in a step away from the system of male domination deeply rooted in Saudi society.

title: U.K. Navy Thwarts Iranian Attempt to Block BP Tanker
summary: Iranian ships turned away after a British warship intervened, U.K. says. A British warship trained its guns on three Iranian vessels that tried to block the passage of a U.K.-flagged oil tanker through the Strait of Hormuz, the country's Defense Ministry said, a confrontation that comes amid heightened tensions between Washington and Tehran.

title: California Legislature Approves Multibillion-Dollar Wildfire Fund
summary: Addressing Wall Street fears, bill aims to help PG&E, other utilities, cover future liability costs. SACRAMENTO, Calif.-California lawmakers on Thursday approved a multibillion-dollar fund meant to stabilize the state's largest utilities amid fears of sizable future liability costs from deadly wildfires tied to their equipment.

title: The New Provence: From Quaint to Uber-Chic
summary: Need proof this beloved vacation spot is evolving? An influx of design-savvy hotels and modern cuisine is reinvigorating the region. So long bouillabaisse. LOOKING THROUGH the picture windows of the dining room at Marseille's Les Bords de Mer, I took in the azure sweep of the Mediterranean. It was broken only by the bone-white Frioul archipelago on the horizon, and in the foreground, a few kids diving into the sea from high rocks. This might be a classic oceanside panorama in Provence, but the restaurant's fastidiously white-and-blonde-wood décor revealed how much this southern patch of France has changed.

title: U.S. Blacklists Venezuelan Intelligence Agency
summary: The designation of the agency follows the death of a Venezuelan navy captain last month. The U.S. imposed sanctions on Venezuela's military counterintelligence agency following the death of a Venezuelan naval officer last month, the Treasury Department said Thursday.

title: This Rice Recipe Has Everything, Plus a Turmeric-Butter-Fried Egg
summary: Quick, easy, inexpensive, even healthyish: This dish of rice and lentils dotted with rich dates is destined to be your new go-to. With that buttery egg on top, it will be your new crush. WITHIN MONTHS of opening her first-ever restaurant, Brooklyn's bright and airy Sofreh, at the age of 59, Nasim Alikhani earned glowing reviews for her cooking. She attributes her success to a lifetime of lessons in traditional Iranian cuisine, some of them humbling. "When I was 11, I cooked rice with lentils and dates for the first time, all by myself," she said. "It was perfect...except the lentils were raw."

title: U.S. Budget Gap Widened 23% in First Nine Months of Fiscal Year
summary: The government collected $2.6 trillion in receipts, a 3% increase, but higher spending on the military and interest on the debt drove federal outlays up 7%. WASHINGTON-Government tax receipts rose again in June but not enough to offset higher federal spending, which pushed the U.S. budget gap to $747 billion for the first nine months of the fiscal year.

title: Bumble Owner, Facing Off With Tinder, Boosts Spending
summary: 'We're looking for the big, big monsters who can partner with me,' billionaire behind Bumble says in an interview. LONDON-The owner of dating app Bumble said it plans to spend $100 million creating an array of new dating apps, part of an expansion and revamp of the privately held holding company that also owns Lumen, a dating app for people over 50, and gay-dating app Chappy.

title: Fed Group Proposes Adjustable-Rate Mortgages Using Libor Replacement
summary: Financial industry group is proposing to use new benchmark designed by central bank. A financial industry group is proposing to use a new benchmark designed by the Federal Reserve for adjustable-rate mortgages, replacing the troubled London interbank offered rate.

title: Man Starts Queens House Fire, Killing Himself and Two Others
summary: FDNY officials said David Abreu Nunez used gasoline to start blaze in multifamily home. A disturbed man who New York City fire officials say started a deadly blaze in a Queens house Wednesday afternoon had been asked to leave by the homeowner earlier in the day, according to the homeowner's husband.

title: Teachers Sue Betsy DeVos Over Public-Service Debt Forgiveness
summary: Lawsuit targets Education Department over handling of program that has canceled less than 1% of applicants' debt. Eight public-school teachers are suing Secretary Betsy DeVos and the Education Department for mishandling a federal program designed to erase the student loans of public-sector employees after 10 years-but which so far has granted forgiveness to less than 1% of applicants.

title: U.K. Envoy's Exit Feeds British Worries of Isolation
summary: Resignation sets off a period of self-examination in the U.K. as the nation struggles to find its place in the world ahead of its planned EU divorce. LONDON-The resignation this week of Britain's ambassador to Washington under duress has set off a period of self-examination in the U.K. as the nation struggles to find its place in the world ahead of its planned European Union exit.

title: Epstein's Lawyers Push for Home Detention in Manhattan Mansion
summary: Attorneys seek to keep financier out of prison pending sex-trafficking trial, dismissing U.S. prosecutors' flight-risk concerns. Lawyers for financier Jeffrey Epstein asked a federal judge to allow Mr. Epstein to remain under home detention at his Manhattan mansion pending his trial on federal sex-trafficking charges.

title: For a Term for 'Earthquake,' the Ground Has Shifted
summary: The meaning of 'temblor' keeps changing. When Southern California was hit by two large earthquakes last week, media accounts followed a familiar pattern. The Associated Press, for instance, led with the news that "a magnitude 7.1 earthquake jolted much of California." The article then reported that the quake on Friday was "preceded by Thursday's 6.4-magnitude temblor in the Mojave Desert."

title: Vatican Mystery Deepens as Tombs Prove Empty in Search for Missing Girl
summary: Tip that Emanuela Orlandi was buried in Vatican City was the latest false lead in the 36-year-old puzzle. ROME-When the Vatican opened two tombs near St. Peter's Basilica on Thursday morning, there was cautious optimism that it might shed some light on a mystery that has haunted Italy, and the Catholic Church, for more than three decades.

title: Treasury to Sell $112 Billion in Debt
summary: U.S. Treasury Department's auctions next week will range from 13-week bills to 10-year TIPS. The U.S. will auction $112 billion in securities next week, comprising $76 billion in new debt and $36 billion in previously sold debt. Details (all with minimum denominations of $100):

title: U.S. Jobless Claims Fell to 3-Month Low During Holiday Week
summary: Decline is a sign employers remain reluctant to let workers go in a tight labor market. WASHINGTON-The number of Americans applying for first-time unemployment benefits fell last week to the lowest level since April, a sign employers remain reluctant to let workers go in a tight labor market.

title: Serena Williams Rocks 'n' Rolls at Wimbledon
summary: After a bumpy start, the eight-time champion finds her rhythm and a ticket to Saturday's final. Wimbledon

title: U.S. Consumer Prices Increased in June
summary: Core prices rose 0.3% from May, the largest monthly rise since January 2018, but economists caution inflation pressure is likely to fade. WASHINGTON-U.S. consumer prices rose at a solid pace in June, but offered few signs of a breakout.

title: Nader Calls for Warren-Sanders Ticket
summary: Former Green party candidate says both leftists are "articulate" and "pretty clean.". Former Green party presidential candidate Ralph Nader says that Sens. Elizabeth Warren (D., Mass.) and Bernie Sanders (Socialist, Vt.), would make a "very powerful ticket" for Democrats in the 2020 general election. Mr. Nader adds that such a combination, combined with aggressive Democratic party efforts to keep Greens off the ballot, would make it hard for a Green party candidate to attract many votes in November of next year.

title: Netflix Could Lose Real Friends
summary: Netflix's future loss of 'Friends' and 'The Office' could take a toll on subscriber growth. It's like Netflix is always stuck in second gear.

title: Farmers Stockpiling Corn in Response to Tough Growing Conditions
summary: Cargill, ADM and other agribusinesses offer big premiums, but many farmers decline to sell; 'they'll be just as hungry for corn in August,' one said. A costly tug of war has broken out over what is usually one of the Farm Belt's most ubiquitous commodities: corn.

title: China Stirs Suspicion With Unusual Maritime-Threat Alert
summary: Countries near strategic Malacca Strait seek explanation for Beijing's emergency warning to ships. Nations that flank the Strait of Malacca are puzzling over why China issued an emergency-level alert for its ships that pass through the vital Asian waterway, and whether strategic calculations are at play.

title: Should an Instant Camera Let You Edit Before You Print?
summary: With Fujifilm's Mini LiPlay, you can select and filter an image before it spits out. But some say digital tricks compromise what makes instant cameras great. RISING FROM the ashes of awkwardly lit '80s Polaroids, instant cameras have become mainstream again. Beyond the Polaroid revival, Fujifilm has flooded the retro-snap market with its Instax line, the latest of which let you digitally customize images before they ever pop out.

title: Fed's Bostic Untroubled by Inflation, Demurs on Rate-Cut Prospects
summary: Atlanta central banker voices confidence in U.S. economy relative to Fed's mandate, declines to take position on policy path. Atlanta Fed leader Raphael Bostic declined on Thursday to say what he wants to see the U.S. central bank do with its short-term rate target at the end of the month but indicated he isn't currently worried about inflation levels.

title: Laguna Beach Home With Secluded Swimming Cove Asks $35 Million
summary: A private staircase leads down to the saltwater swimming area, which is built into the rocks. A cliff-side home in Laguna Beach, Calif., with its own swimming cove is coming on the market for $35 million.

title: Charming Charlie Files Second Bankruptcy in Less Than Two Years
summary: Accessories and clothing retailer plans to close remaining 261 stores. Accessories and clothing retailer Charming Charlie Holdings Inc. said it plans to close its remaining 261 stores and has permanently stopped online sales as part of its second bankruptcy filing in less than two years.

title: Book Culture Chain Joins Other New York Retailers Fighting to Stay Open
summary: Store owner Chris Doeblin says, 'It's hard to be a really small business anymore and to pay for what it costs to live in the city'. A chain of independent bookstores is following a story line playing out around New York City: Small businesses are struggling with high rents.

title: Judge Approves Harvey Weinstein's Request for New Lawyers
summary: Change comes two months before disgraced Hollywood producer's sex-crime trial begins. A state judge in New York on Thursday approved the latest shuffle of Harvey Weinstein's legal team two months before the disgraced Hollywood producer's sex-crimes trial is set to begin.

title: The Billion-Dollar Question Hanging Over NFL Labor Talks
summary: NFL owners say an 18-game regular season would drastically increase revenues, but players are pushing back. At the most recent collective bargaining session between the NFL and its players union, Patriots owner Robert Kraft, Cowboys owner Jerry Jones and the league decision-makers proffered one of the most tantalizing ideas in professional football: What about an 18-game regular season?

title: Motion and Illusion
summary: Hungarian artist Dóra Maurer has been a dissident and an innovator.. At the age of 82, Dóra Maurer is one of Eastern Europe's leading conceptual artists, with an innovative body of work in film, photography and paint. She is equally noteworthy for her mastery of color and for her achievements as a dissident artist working under Hungary's repressive Communist regime. Ms. Maurer has never been a household name, but that's not what she was after: "I don't want to be a star or suchlike," she has said. "I'm not the type."

title: Bright Spot for Money Managers: ESG
summary: Record amount flows to funds engaged in socially responsible investing. A record amount is flowing to investment managers who specialize in socially responsible investing, providing a bright spot for stock pickers who have otherwise struggled to keep client money.

title: Pop-Up Tents No S'more: Glamping Is the New Backyard Camping
summary: Homeowners are putting up tricked-out tents on their properties to help them unplug or to use as glorified guesthouses. When designer Ken Fulk wants to get away from it all, he doesn't have to go far. He heads for a canvas platform tent set on a hillside at his Durham Ranch in Napa, Calif., outfitted with the bare essentials: queen-size bed with zebra-pattern throw pillows, antique leather stools and a whiskey bar.

title: Trump Calls Deutsche Bank 'Maligned'
summary: Bank faces mounting regulatory and congressional scrutiny. President Trump called Deutsche Bank AG a "now badly written about and maligned" bank, remarks that come as the longtime lender to Trump-related businesses is slashing its workforce and faces mounting regulatory and congressional scrutiny.

title: T-Mobile-Sprint Talks Slow Over Dish Ownership
summary: Parties expect to extend merger agreement past July 29 as they discuss conditions for new wireless venture and the postmerger T-Mobile. Negotiations to complete the merger of T-Mobile US Inc. and Sprint Corp. are dragging on as the parties haggle over ownership restrictions and other conditions for Dish Network Corp. once it gets assets from the wireless companies, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Sicily's Under-the-Radar Whites: Great Wines If You Can Get Them
summary: While Sicily's red wines have gained a following stateside, the white wines produced there have yet to get the attention they deserve. Here, a few highly drinkable Sicilian whites worth seeking out this summer. ON MY FIRST TRIP to Sicily about 12 years ago, I had lunch at a restaurant in Palermo. The wine list featured two choices: Corvo Rosso and Corvo Bianco, the same two Sicilian options then found in most American restaurants and stores. Fast-forward a few years and now complex, serious Sicilian reds abound on both sides of the Atlantic-while Sicilian whites are still largely unknown.

title: How Early Do Cultural Differences Start?
summary: A new study shows that by the age of 3, American and Chinese children have different ways of thinking about objects and relationships.. Do our culture and language shape the way we think? A new paper in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, by Caren Walker at the University of California at San Diego, Alex Carstensen at Stanford and their colleagues, tried to answer this ancient question. The researchers discovered that very young Chinese and American toddlers start out thinking about the world in similar ways. But by the time they are 3 years old, they are already showing differences based on their cultures.

title: ECB Follows Fed in Signaling Fresh Stimulus
summary: Minutes for June meeting suggest ECB could cut interest rates or restart its $2.92 trillion bond-buying program. FRANKFURT-European Central Bank officials signaled at their June policy meeting that they will consider injecting fresh stimulus into the eurozone economy through interest-rate cuts or the relaunch of a €2.6 trillion ($2.9 trillion) bond-buying program, amid deep concerns over slowing global growth and trade disputes.

title: For Sale in Malta: A Path to EU Citizenship
summary: Foreign buyers are fueling the tiny island nation's red-hot real-estate market, which offers outsiders pleasant weather conditions and the option to become EU citizens. Bonnie and Michael Kelly were eager to buy a home in Europe after Mr. Kelly retired from his job at a pharmaceutical company. After two or three years of consideration, the couple, who live in York Harbor, Maine, chose Malta, an archipelago in the Mediterranean about 50 miles south of Sicily, Italy.

title: Income Options Are Coming to 401(k) Plans
summary: Advisers say annuities can make sense for retirees unable to cover their basic living expenses. A growing number of employers are exploring ways to help 401(k) participants turn their savings into a sustainable income in retirement, even ahead of Congress passing legislation that would make it easier to do so.

title: France Presses On With Digital Tax Despite U.S. Probe
summary: The measure will apply a 3% tax on revenue in France from some digital activities by large companies. France's legislature gave final approval to a new tax on large tech companies like Alphabet Inc.'s Google and Amazon.com Inc., shrugging off the threat posed by a new U.S. trade probe into whether the measure discriminates against American firms.

title: U.N. Calls for Probe on Philippines Drug War
summary: Human Rights Council votes for investigation into killings by police. The United Nations Human Rights Council voted to launch an investigation into the alleged killings of tens of thousands of Filipinos by police in a yearslong drug war-a rare international rebuke of Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte, who started the campaign against narcotics.

title: The Clinic That Helps Seniors Find the Right Marijuana Treatment
summary: More older people are trying cannabis to alleviate pain and other ailments, but they're often left taking medical advice from dispensary sales clerks. NiaMedic wants to change that.. Author

title: In Awkwafina's Drama Debut, Family Matters
summary: She went from working in a Brooklyn deli to anchoring one of the summer's buzziest indies-all while moonlighting as a rapper, comedian and sitcom creator. How 31-year-old Awkwafina, aka Nora Lum, is quenching our thirst for a wild success story.. In a climactic scene of the film The Farewell, three generations of a Chinese family are leaning hard into a drinking game. The ostensible reason is a wedding, and they joke and toast the happy couple while the camera swirls woozily around the table. But the unmentioned guest is cancer. It's spreading through the matriarch grandmother's lungs, its presence known to everyone except for Nai Nai herself. As the screen frames each face, expressions soften. The entire group is drinking to forget her diagnosis, but also to remember this moment. They relax wordlessly into a cross-generational bond.

title: Japan's Restrictions on South Korean Chip Makers Backfire
summary: Samsung and SK Hynix watch their share prices rise, along with chip prices. SEOUL-Japan's trade jab at South Korea's chip makers was meant to be painful, but a week in, it appears to have given a momentary victory to the core targets: Samsung Electronics Co. and SK Hynix Inc.

title: North Korea Threatens the South Over Purchase of U.S. Stealth Jets
summary: Triggered by Seoul's stealth-fighter purchase, Pyongyang warns it will 'completely destroy' lethal weapons placed in South Korea. SEOUL-North Korea called the planned mid-July delivery of two U.S. stealth jet fighters to South Korea an affront to last year's pledge by the two countries to tone down military tensions on the peninsula, saying it had no choice but to develop arms to counter them.

title: A New Chapter for Norwegian Air?
summary: Chief executive Bjørn Kjos is stepping down and trans-Atlantic profitability is improving, but starting a new era won't be so easy. Troubled budget airline Norwegian Air Shuttle is trying to turn the page: Its chief executive is stepping down and flights between the U.S. and Europe are finally becoming more profitable. But investors shouldn't hold their breath.

title: Fast Times at Uniqlo's Owner Could Continue
summary: Fast Retailing's shares have been flying high, with the Bank of Japan providing some of the fuel. Japanese apparel giant Fast Retailing , which owns the Uniqlo brand, has been raking in cash from Chinese consumers. But the Bank of Japan is another source of support.

title: OPEC Maintains World Oil Demand Forecast as Supply Concerns Continue
summary: Organization cuts its 2019 oil production growth forecast for its non-cartel peers. LONDON-OPEC cut its 2019 oil production growth forecast for its non-cartel peers, a week after the bloc and its allies extended their continuing output cut for another nine months.

title: Snap Has an Age Limit
summary: While stock of Snapchat's parent is on a tear, focus on youth could prevent graceful aging. Age is just a number, but it matters when building a social-media platform.

title: Marco Rubio Introduces a Bill to Boost the U.S. Rare-Earth Industry
summary: Florida senator says China has subsidized its industry for rare earths. WASHINGTON-Legislation aimed at making the U.S. more competitive with China for processing critical rare-earth minerals is set to be introduced in Congress on Thursday.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Warns Shipping Industry on Cybersecurity
summary: Hackers attempted to digitally seize control of a vessel in February, an incident that shows risks the sector faces. In February, pirates attempted to seize control of a shipping vessel en route to the Port of New York and New Jersey. Rather than hijacking it with assault rifles and rocket launchers, the criminals boarded the ship digitally.

title: Boston's Transit Frustrations Mount After Derailment
summary: Critics want faster improvements to aging system that provides 1.2 million trips a day for a growing metro area. Bostonians are losing patience with their transit system.

summary: Some indebted borrowers are running into trouble due to a cooling housing market and slowing economy. Risky borrowers are running into trouble in China and that is putting pressure on trust companies, an important corner of the country's shadow-banking system.

title: S&P Rating Is Landmark for Chinese Bond Market
summary: Investors hope global raters will improve the quality of the local ratings industry, but some fear they will bow to pressure and be less critical. SHANGHAI- S&P Global Inc. became the first foreign credit-rating company to offer an independent assessment of risk in China's vast domestic debt market, giving a top grade to a unit of the country's largest bank.

title: China's Newly Created Dajia Insurance Begins Absorbing Anbang
summary: Dajia to take stakes in life- and pension-insurance, asset-management and property-and-casualty businesses. BEIJING-Chinese authorities disclosed some details of a restructuring of Anbang Insurance Group's assets under a new name that now appears on the company's headquarters in Beijing.

title: Malone May Return to Univision's Telenovela
summary: A group of private investors is looking to offload the Spanish-language group after walking away from an offer from the media mogul in 2017. Spanish-language media company Univision Communications wants to sell itself again. Owners including Saban Capital Group, Providence Equity Partners, TPG and others walked away from an offer from media mogul John Malone two years ago. Several media companies could be interested, but most are distracted. That gives Mr. Malone an opening.

title: PC Shipments Rise After Several Quarters of Decline
summary: Sales bump linked to upgrades for Windows 10 and an easing of the shortage in Intel processors. Personal-computer shipments rose in the second quarter for the first time since last year, two research companies said Thursday, as businesses sought upgrades to technology with new Windows 10 software and a shortage in processors eased.

title: Jim Bouton, Ex-Yankee Who Wrote 'Ball Four,' Dies
summary: Retired pitcher shocked and angered baseball's establishment with tell-all book. GREAT BARRINGTON, Mass.-Jim Bouton, the former New York Yankees pitcher who shocked and angered the conservative baseball world with the tell-all book "Ball Four," has died. He was 80 years old.

title: SEC Clears Blockstack to Hold First Regulated Token Offering
summary: Development could give young cryptocurrency businesses a new fundraising template. The Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday cleared blockchain startup Blockstack to sell bitcoin-like digital tokens, a first-of-its-kind offering that could give young cryptocurrency businesses a new fundraising template.

title: Mnuchin Urges Suppliers to Seek Huawei Exemptions
summary: Licenses would allow U.S. suppliers to resume sales to blacklisted Chinese firm. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin in recent days urged U.S. suppliers of Huawei Technologies Co. to seek licenses to resume sales to the blacklisted Chinese firm, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Queens District Attorney Primary Could Take Weeks to Call
summary: More than 91,000 ballots will be recounted by hand. New York City election officials said in court Tuesday that the Democratic primary for Queens district attorney could take weeks to call because of an unprecedented manual recount of more than 91,000 votes.

title: White House Picks Adm. Mike Gilday to Be Next Chief of Naval Operations
summary: Selection follows ousting of Adm. Bill Moran, who was expected to assume duties this summer, after ethics scandal. WASHINGTON-President Trump will nominate Navy Vice Adm. Mike Gilday to be the next top officer of the Navy, three U.S. officials said, after the confirmed nominee, Adm. Bill Moran, was ousted earlier this week over an ethics issue.

title: Powell Says Outlook Hasn't Improved, Setting Stage for Rate Cut
summary: Fed chairman says trade uncertainties and concerns about global growth weakness continue to weigh on economy. WASHINGTON-Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell signaled the central bank is ready to cut interest rates later this month to cushion the U.S. economy against the risks of slower global growth and trade-policy uncertainty.

title: AT&T Cuts Ad Sales Staff at WarnerMedia Unit
summary: Sales Chief Donna Speciale is among those leaving. AT&T Inc.'s WarnerMedia began making significant job cuts in its ad sales division on Wednesday, according to people familiar with the matter, as it continues to reshape the businesses it bought in as part of the Time Warner Inc. deal last year.

title: State Department Analyst Resigns After White House Blocked Climate Change Testimony
summary: Rod Schoonover was prohibited from including evidence and data supporting his assessments in testimony to House committee. WASHINGTON-A State Department intelligence analyst has resigned in protest after the White House blocked portions of his written testimony to a congressional panel to exclude data and evidence on climate change and its threat to national security, State Department officials said.

title: Trump Comments on Immigrants Could Factor in Census Case, Judge Says
summary: Federal lawsuit alleges citizenship question was intended to discriminate against Hispanics. WASHINGTON-A federal judge in Maryland said Wednesday that President Trump's public remarks about immigrants and personal insistence on placing a citizenship question on the census could help determine whether the government intended to discriminate against Hispanics by adding the query.

title: Brazil's Congress Votes in Favor of Pension Overhaul Bill in First-Round Vote
summary: Proposed legislation must face another test in the lower house before heading to Senate. SÃO PAULO-Brazilian lawmakers voted in favor of a bill to overhaul the country's insolvent pension system, the first and most important hurdle in the bill's passage through Congress and a major win for the government of President Jair Bolsonaro.
